</figcaption></figure></div>
<div id="article-content_1-0" class="comp article-content mntl-block"><div id="mntl-sc-page_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-page mntl-block structured-content" data-sc-sticky-offset="90" data-sc-ad-label-height="24" data-sc-ad-track-spacing="100" data-sc-min-track-height="250" data-sc-max-track-height="600" data-sc-breakpoint="50em" data-sc-load-immediate="4" data-sc-content-positions="[1, 1250, 1550, 1950, 2350, 2750, 3150, 3550, 3950]" data-bind-scroll-on-start="true"><p id="mntl-sc-block_1-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Magnesium is a mineral that's needed for important processes such as nerve function, blood pressure and blood sugar regulation, bone health maintenance, and more.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_2-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_3-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Your daily magnesium needs depend on factors like your age and gender. Adult males need 400-420 milligrams of magnesium per day, and adult females require 310-400 milligrams per day.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="1"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_4-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_5-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Nearly half of the United States population falls short of their daily magnesium intake needs, which can increase their risk of conditions like <a href="https://www.health.com/heart-disease-causes-7094403" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">heart disease</a>.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="1"></span><span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="3"></span> Eating more magnesium-rich foods, like fruit, can help boost magnesium intake. 
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_6-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-1-prickly-pear"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_7-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> 1. Prickly Pear </span> </h2>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_8-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">
<div class="img-placeholder" style="padding-bottom:66.6%;">
<img

<figcaption id="mntl-figure-caption_1-0" class="comp mntl-figure-caption type-label--md figure-article-caption"> <span class="figure-article-caption-owner"><p>lacaosa / Getty Images</p></span>
</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_9-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.health.com/prickly-pear-benefits-7642893" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Prickly pear</a> is a plant native to Mexico. It grows oval-shaped fruits that have a sweet, berry-like flavor.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="5"></span><span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="4"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_10-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_11-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Prickly pears are healthy and high in several vitamins, minerals, and healthy plant compounds. These fruits are one of the best sources of magnesium you can eat. 
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_12-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_13-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> A 1-cup serving of raw prickly pear fruit contains 127 milligrams of magnesium, which is 30% of the Daily Value (DV) for magnesium.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="1"></span><span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="6"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_14-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_15-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Prickly pears are also rich in vitamin C and fiber. Vitamin C is essential for immune function, while fiber promotes <a class="recommendation-inline-link" href="https://www.health.com/how-to-heal-your-gut-8769420" link-destination-recommendation="true" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">gut health</a> by supporting regular bowel movements and encouraging the growth of healthy bacteria in your digestive tract. A cup of raw prickly pear provides 23% of your DV for vitamin C and 19.2% for fiber.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="6"></span><span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="29"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_16-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-2-dried-figs"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_17-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> 2. Dried Figs </span> </h2>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_18-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">
<div class="img-placeholder" style="padding-bottom:66.6%;">
<img

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_19-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Dried <a href="https://www.health.com/health-benefits-of-figs-7571179" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">figs</a> are an excellent source of magnesium. One cup provides 101 milligrams, 24% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="7"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_20-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_21-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> In addition to magnesium, figs are high in <a href="https://www.health.com/high-fiber-foods-8667142" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">fiber</a> and other vitamins and minerals, like vitamin B6 and calcium. A cup of dried figs contains 14.6 grams of fiber, which covers over 50% of the DV for fiber.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_22-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_23-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Figs are also packed with polyphenol antioxidants, which protect against cellular damage and regulate inflammation.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="8"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_24-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-3-durian"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_25-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> 3. Durian </span> </h2>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_26-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_27-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.health.com/durian-benefits-8609127" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Durian</a> is a large tropical fruit native to Southeast Asia. It has a creamy texture and a sweet yet bitter taste. Durian is known for its strong smell—sometimes described as a combination of sulfur and rotten onions.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="11"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_28-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_29-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Durian is a good source of fiber and several vitamins and minerals, including vitamin C, <a class="recommendation-inline-link" href="https://www.health.com/potassium-7564162" link-destination-recommendation="true" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">potassium</a>, B vitamins, and magnesium. A cup of raw durian contains 72.9 milligrams of magnesium, 17% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="9"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_30-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_31-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> The same serving contains 53% of the DV for vitamin C, which functions as an antioxidant in the body and is required for immune function, collagen synthesis, and neurotransmitter production.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="10"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_32-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-4-passion-fruit"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_33-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> 4. Passion Fruit </span> </h2>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_34-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

<p id="mntl-sc-block_35-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.health.com/passion-fruit-benefits-8426147" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Passion fruit</a> is a vining plant native to South America. The plant produces small fruits with hard rinds ranging from green to purple, depending on ripeness. 
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_36-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_37-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> The soft, seed-filled flesh of passion fruit is a good source of several nutrients, including magnesium. A cup of passionfruit contains 68.4 milligrams of magnesium, 16.2% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="30"></span><span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="12"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_38-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_39-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> It's also a good source of <a href="https://www.health.com/vitamin-a-benefits-8689943" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">vitamin A</a>, providing 16.7% of the DV. Vitamin A is needed for vision, reproductive health, immune function, and normal growth and development.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="13"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_40-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-5-jackfruit"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_41-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> 5. Jackfruit  </span> </h2>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_42-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_43-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.health.com/jackfruit-benefits-8600924" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Jackfruit</a> is the fruit of the <em>Artocarpus heterophyllus </em>tree, which is native to India. Jackfruits are the largest edible fruit in the world and can grow up to 110 pounds.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="14"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_44-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_45-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> A cup of raw jackfruit contains 47 milligrams of magnesium, 11% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="15"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_46-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_47-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> The same serving covers 16% of the DV for <a href="https://www.health.com/potassium-rich-foods-to-try-7644762" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">potassium</a>. Like magnesium, potassium is necessary for blood pressure regulation. Eating more foods high in potassium and magnesium may help reduce high blood pressure and lower the risk of heart disease.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="17"></span><span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="16"></span><br>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_48-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>

<figure id="mntl-sc-block_50-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_51-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.health.com/nutrition/avocado-health-benefits" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Avocados</a> are one of the healthiest fruits you can eat. They are rich in a number of nutrients, including fiber, healthy fats, and minerals like magnesium. A cup of cubed avocado contains 43.5 milligrams of magnesium, 10.35% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="18"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_52-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_53-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Unlike most other fruits, avocados are low in carbohydrates and high in healthy fats, making them a good option for those on low-carbohydrate diets, like <a href="https://www.health.com/keto-guidance-7111514" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">keto diets</a>, and those with diabetes.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_54-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_55-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> They're also high in fiber, which promotes healthy blood sugar control by slowing the absorption of sugar into the bloodstream. A cup of cubed avocado provides 35% of the DV for fiber.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="18"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_56-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-7-dried-apricots"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_57-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> 7. Dried Apricots </span> </h2>
<figure id="mntl-sc-block_58-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_59-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Dried apricots are sweet and chewy, making them an excellent option for those craving a <a href="https://www.health.com/high-protein-desserts-8558885" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">healthy alternative</a> to sweets like candy. 
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_60-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_61-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> A cup of dried apricots provides 41.6 milligrams of magnesium, 9.9% of the DV. They are also packed with other nutrients, such as potassium and iron.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="19"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_62-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_63-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> The same serving of dried apricots covers 19.2% of the DV for iron, which is needed for oxygen transportation, growth, energy production, hormone synthesis, and neurological development.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="20"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_64-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_67-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Bananas are tropical fruits that contain an impressive amount of nutrients. A cup of banana slices contains 40.6 milligrams of magnesium, 9.6% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="21"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_68-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_69-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Bananas are also high in <a href="https://www.health.com/vitamin-b6-deficiency-symptoms-8598416" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">vitamin B6</a>, a B vitamin needed for metabolism, immune function, neurotransmitter production, and the formation of hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying part of red blood cells.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="22"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_70-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>

<figure id="mntl-sc-block_72-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

<p id="mntl-sc-block_73-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> <a href="https://www.health.com/guava-benefits-8643503" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Guava</a> is a tropical fruit with a sweet but tart taste. It's a good source of magnesium, with a cup of guava providing 36.4 milligrams of magnesium, or 8.6% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="23"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_74-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_75-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Guava stands out from other fruits because it's relatively high in protein, providing 4.21 grams per cup. This fruit is also rich in vitamin C, with the same serving covering over 400% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="23"></span><br/>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_76-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>

<figure id="mntl-sc-block_78-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image mntl-sc-block-image--no-theme no-theme figure-landscape figure-high-res"> <div class="figure-media">

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_79-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Papayas are large tropical fruits with bright orange, sweet-tasting flesh. <a href="https://www.health.com/papaya-benefits-8628233" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">Papaya</a> is a good source of vitamins and minerals, including magnesium. A cup of papaya contains 34.6 milligrams of magnesium, 8.2% of the DV.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="24"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_80-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_81-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Papayas are also high in <a class="recommendation-inline-link" href="https://www.health.com/foods-high-in-folate-8403882" link-destination-recommendation="true" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">folate,</a> vitamin C, and carotenoid antioxidants. They are especially high in lycopene, a carotenoid pigment with powerful heart-protective properties. Research shows that following a diet high in lycopene is an effective way to lower heart disease risk.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="25"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_82-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-11-blackberries"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_83-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> 11. Blackberries </span> </h2>

</figcaption></figure>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_85-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> A cup of <a href="https://www.health.com/blackberries-benefits-8694948" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">blackberries</a> contains 28.8 milligrams of magnesium, 7% of the DV. They are also high in vitamins C and K and <a href="https://www.health.com/manganese-8743206" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="2">manganese</a>, a mineral involved in immune health, energy metabolism, and nervous system function.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="28"></span><span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="26"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_86-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_87-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Blackberries contain concentrated antioxidants, such as phenolic acids and anthocyanins, which give them powerful anti-inflammatory and cellular protective properties.<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="27"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_88-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_89-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-digiohembed"> <div

</div>
</div>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_90-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-other-food-sources-of-magnesium"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_91-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> Other Food Sources of Magnesium </span> </h2>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_92-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> In addition to fruits, magnesium can be found in <a href="https://www.health.com/weight-loss/the-healthiest-nuts-for-your-body" data-component="link" data-source="inlineLink" data-type="internalLink" data-ordinal="1">nuts</a>, vegetables, seeds, and beans.
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_93-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_94-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Here are some of the best dietary sources of magnesium:<span class="ql-inline-citation" data-cite="1"></span>
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_95-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<ul id="mntl-sc-block_96-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> <li><strong>Spinach:</strong> 156 milligrams (mg) per cooked cup, or 37% of the Daily Value (DV)</li><li><strong>Pumpkin seeds:</strong> 156 mg per ounce, or 37% of the DV</li><li><strong>Chia seeds: </strong>111 mg per ounce, or 26% of the DV</li><li><strong>Black beans:</strong> 120 mg per cup, or 28% of the DV</li><li><strong>Edamame:</strong> 100 mg per cup, or 24% of the DV</li><li><strong>Brown rice:</strong> 84 mg per cup, or 20% of the DV</li><li><strong>Almonds:</strong> 80 mg per ounce, or 19% of the DV</li><li><strong>Cashews:</strong> 74 mg per ounce, or 18% of the DV</li><li><strong>Soy milk:</strong> 61 mg per cup, or 15% of the DV</li><li><strong>Yogurt:</strong> 42 mg per 8 ounces, or 10% of the DV</li>
</ul>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_97-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_98-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> To ensure you hit your daily magnesium requirements, try consuming a variety of magnesium-rich foods, like greens, beans, nuts, and seeds. 
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_99-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<span class="heading-toc" id="toc-a-quick-review"></span><h2 id="mntl-sc-block_100-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block healthdotcom-sc-block-heading mntl-sc-block-heading"> <span class="mntl-sc-block-heading__text"> A Quick Review </span> </h2>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_101-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Magnesium is a mineral needed to regulate blood pressure, nerve function, and many other critical body processes. 
</p>
<div id="mntl-sc-block_102-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-adslot mntl-block"></div>
<p id="mntl-sc-block_103-0" class="comp mntl-sc-block mntl-sc-block-html"> Some fruits, like prickly pear, jackfruit, durian, and blackberries, are high in magnesium. Try incorporating these and other magnesium-rich foods into your diet to help you meet your daily magnesium needs.<br/>
</p></div>
